case2: A self-driving car with sudden brake failure will continue ahead and drive through a crossing which will be used by predestrians to cross in the other lane ahead. This will result in the death of 2 Woman who were crossing ahead of the car​
Justification: Based on Utilitarian Ethics, I have made this decision. According to Utilitarianism, actions are approved when they promote happiness or pleasure and disapproved of when they cause unhappiness or pain. One ought to maximize the overall good — that is, consider the good of others as well as one's own good. In this scenario, by swerving and driving through the crossing used by pedestrians in the other lane, I am prioritizing the safety of the 2 men who will otherwise be run over. This decision will likely result in a greater overall good for the people involved, as it saves the lives of the two men. On the other hand, if the car continues ahead and runs over the two women crossing ahead, this would result in avoidable deaths that could have been prevented by swerving to safety.
